required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Psychosocial Needs of HIV+ Young Men Who Have Sex With Men (YMSM)

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: The proposed study will use both qualitative and quantitative research methods (mixed methods) to gather data that will support the eventual development of interventions for young men who have sex with men (YMSM) living with behaviorally acquired HIV infection. The overall goal of the study is to gain an understanding of the psychosocial/developmental needs of YMSM by focusing on two critical developmental issuesâ€”identity development and future life goals.

primary_outcome.measure: An understanding of the most salient risk factors/stressors and resistance factors/coping mechanisms that impact healthy identity development among YMSM living with HIV.

An understanding of the association between ethnic identity, sexual identity, and identity as a young man living with HIV and the health behaviors of substance use, sexual activity, and adherence to healthcare among YMSM living with HIV.
An understanding of the most salient risk factors/stressors and resistance factors/coping mechanisms that negatively impact the future life goals of YMSM living with HIV.
Identification of additional psychosocial/developmental needs of YMSM living with HIV (in addition to healthy identity development and future life goals).

Development of recommendations for interventions aimed at facilitating healthy identity development, constructing future life goals, and addressing additional psychosocial/developmental needs among YMSM living with HIV.

arm_group.description: Male, HIV+ participants from ages 16-24 who have had sex with another male in the past year and acquired HIV behaviorally. Participants will be drawn from four participating AMTU sites.
Male, HIV+ participants from ages 16-24 who have had sex with another male in the past year and acquired HIV behaviorally. Participants will be drawn from all fifteen AMTU sites.

study_pop.textblock: Male, HIV+ participants from ages 16-24 who have had sex with another male in the past year and accquired HIV behaviorally.

facility.name: University of California at San Francisco
University of South Florida College of Medicine
John Stroger Jr. Hospital of Cook County
University of MD School of Medicine
